column3: Organizer texts Auto Sync when account has 0 crews
column4: System replies “no crews” message and ends flow (no draft created).

column2: Auto Sync start: crew name recognized
column3: Organizer texts Auto Sync Friends (crew exists)
column4: System selects crew and prompts: “Event name?” (or equivalent event-name prompt).

column2: Auto Sync start: crew name not recognized
column3: Organizer texts Auto Sync FakeCrew
column4: System replies crew-not-found message with options to retry/create/exit; no draft created.

column3: After crew selection, organizer submits empty/whitespace event name
column4: System re-prompts for event name; does not proceed.

column3: Organizer submits valid event name
column4: System proceeds to time definition step (calendar-mode prompt for windows OR no-calendar prompt for concrete times, depending on calendar connectivity).

column3: Organizer types exit during setup (before sending)
column4: System exits to normal chat; Auto Sync draft discarded; auto sync check shows nothing.

column3: Organizer has Google Calendar connected; texts Auto Sync and proceeds
column4: System does not ask to connect calendar; uses calendar-mode time-window prompt.

column3: Organizer has no calendar connected; texts Auto Sync and proceeds
column4: System does not ask to connect calendar; uses no-calendar prompt requiring 1–3 concrete times.

column3: Organizer without calendar completes full Auto Sync setup
column4: At no point does system prompt “connect calendar”; only time zone prompt appears at send-time if needed.

column2: Calendar mode: time window input accepted
column3: Calendar connected; organizer provides NL window (e.g., “weeknights next week”)
column4: System acknowledges and moves into “propose option” loop (shows first option + week view).

column3: Calendar connected; system proposes option
column4: Organizer receives: (a) week-level calendar visual for Mon–Sun, (b) one highlighted proposed slot, (c) instruction to reply yes (save), next, or suggest change.

column2: Calendar mode: next shows another option
column3: Organizer replies next
column4: System shows next option (same structure: week view + highlighted time + prompt).

column3: Organizer replies yes to a proposal
column4: System confirms saved option and prompts: “Send Auto Sync, add another option, or exit?” (or equivalent).

column3: Organizer saves a second option
column4: System confirms second save and prompts to send/add/exit.

column2: Calendar mode: save third option and enforce max
column3: Organizer saves a third option
column4: System confirms third save and states max reached; prompt includes only send or exit.

column2: Calendar mode: suggest valid change same week
column3: Organizer suggests a new time within shown week with no conflict
column4: System updates highlighted time to suggested time and asks for confirmation to save / next (no error).

column3: Organizer suggests time that conflicts on organizer calendar
column4: System responds “conflicts” and returns to same decision prompt (save/suggest/next), without saving.

column2: Calendar mode: suggest time in different week
column3: Organizer suggests time outside currently shown week
column4: System loads new week view, highlights suggested time, asks for confirmation to save / next.

column2: Calendar mode: no fully open window (closest option)
column3: Organizer’s calendar has no fully open window in requested range
column4: System returns “closest option” proposal (still one option + week view + prompt).

column2: Calendar mode: calendar access failure mid-flow
column3: Calendar token/API fails during proposal loop
column4: System returns calendar access error and exits/discards the in-progress Auto Sync (no active Auto Sync remains).

column3: No calendar; organizer provides exactly 1 concrete date/time
column4: System accepts as option set of size 1 and prompts to add another or proceed toward send confirmation.

column3: No calendar; organizer provides 2 or 3 concrete date/times
column4: System accepts up to 3 options; if 3 provided, proceeds to goal + send confirmation.

column3: No calendar; organizer attempts to add a 4th time
column4: System rejects additional option and confirms max reached; offers send or exit.

column3: After options captured (calendar or no-calendar)
column4: System prompts: “Reply 1 Everyone, 2 Critical mass” (or equivalent).

column3: Organizer replies invalid value (e.g., “3”)
column4: System re-prompts with same goal options; does not proceed.

column3: Organizer replies 1
column4: System proceeds to send confirmation prompt.

column3: Organizer replies 2
column4: System proceeds to send confirmation prompt; behavior thereafter identical to 1.

column3: After goal selection
column4: System prompts: “Ready to start? Reply send or exit” (or equivalent).

column3: Organizer replies send
column4: System begins Auto Sync execution: sends invitee messages; sends organizer “Auto Sync sent to [TOTAL] people.”

column3: Organizer replies yes or y
column4: Same as AS-029.

column3: Organizer replies invalid (e.g., “go”)
column4: System re-prompts: “Reply send or exit.”

column2: Time zone required at send-time (no calendar, no stored TZ)
column3: No calendar and user.time_zone not set; organizer replies send
column4: Before any invitee messages, system prompts numbered TZ list (PT/MT/CT/ET/AKT/HT).

column2: Time zone selection valid maps and continues
column3: From AS-032, organizer selects a valid number
column4: System confirms TZ (briefly) and immediately proceeds to send invitee availability SMS + organizer “sent” confirmation.

column3: From AS-032, organizer sends invalid value
column4: System re-prompts for number 1–6; does not send any invitee messages.

column2: Exit at time zone prompt cancels send
column3: From AS-032, organizer types exit
column4: System cancels sending; returns to normal chat; no active Auto Sync exists.

column2: Stored time zone reused next time
column3: Organizer without calendar sets TZ once, completes, later starts another Auto Sync
column4: System does not ask for TZ again at send-time; proceeds directly to sending.

column3: Auto Sync started with 1 option
column4: Invitee receives: header “[Organizer] is finding a time for [Event]” + options list with explicit TZ + instruction “Reply with number(s) or none.”

column3: Auto Sync started with 2–3 options
column4: Invitee receives numbered list 1..N with explicit dates/times and TZ; includes “none” instruction.

column3: Invitee replies 1
column4: System records response for option 1; does not require clarification; response counts update for organizer views.

column2: Invitee reply: multiple numbers with text
column3: Invitee replies “1 and 2 work”
column4: System extracts {1,2}, ignores text, records both; no clarification prompt.

column3: Invitee replies none
column4: System records as none available for that Auto Sync.

column2: Invitee reply: invalid (no valid numbers, not none)
column3: Invitee replies “maybe” or “ok”
column4: System replies corrective instruction: “Reply with the number(s) that work for you, or none if nothing works.”

column3: Invitee replies 1, then later replies 2
column4: Latest reply replaces previous for that Auto Sync.

column3: Invitee replies none, then later 1
column4: Latest reply replaces previous.

column2: 24h auto reminder sends to non-responders only
column3: After 24 hours from initial start
column4: Only invitees with no response receive reminder; responders do not.

column3: At 24-hour reminder time
column4: Organizer receives update message with [EVENT], [PENDING]/[TOTAL] and instruction to use auto sync check (or equivalent).

column3: At 48 hours from initial start
column4: Organizer receives paused summary including: responded/total + counts + menu options (send reminder, send invites, exit).

column2: Invitee replies after pause are accepted
column3: After pause summary is sent, invitee replies
column4: System records reply; counts reflect updated state when organizer checks.

column3: Organizer chooses “send another reminder” from paused menu
column4: System sends reminder to current non-responders; Auto Sync returns to Running.

column3: After AS-049, wait 24 hours
column4: Auto Sync pauses again and sends paused summary to organizer; no automatic reminder is sent in this cycle.

column3: Organizer repeats send-reminder action multiple times
column4: System allows repeats; each reminder returns to Running, then pauses after 24h.

column3: While Auto Sync is Running, organizer triggers “send invites” action
column4: System proceeds to standard Send Invites flow and completes Auto Sync immediately after invites are sent.

column3: While Auto Sync is Paused, organizer triggers “send invites” action
column4: Same as AS-052.

column2: Send invites handoff uses existing flow
column3: Organizer triggers send invites from Auto Sync
column4: System uses standard Send Invites prompts/steps (if any) to finalize and send calendar invite; no new Auto Sync-specific “pick option” step is required unless standard flow requires it.

column2: Invitee receives invite confirmation after invites sent
column3: After send invites completes
column4: Invitee receives invite confirmation message including event name + date/time + explicit TZ; calendar invite created/sent.

column3: After send invites, invitee replies to old Auto Sync thread
column4: System replies “Got it — thanks.” (reply does not affect Auto Sync).

column3: Organizer selects stop while Running
column4: System asks confirm; on yes, stops Auto Sync; auto sync check no longer lists it.

column3: Organizer selects stop while Paused
column4: Same confirm + stop behavior; not listed afterward.

column3: After stop, invitee replies to old request
column4: System replies “Got it — thanks.”

column2: Auto Sync Check lists only active (Running/Paused)
column3: Organizer texts auto sync check with active Auto Syncs
column4: System lists only Running/Paused Auto Syncs with responded/total; provides selection instructions.

column2: Auto Sync Check shows none when no active
column3: Organizer texts auto sync check with no Running/Paused
column4: System responds no active Auto Syncs + how to start.

column3: From AS-060, organizer selects a Running Auto Sync
column4: System shows “Running” management menu with actions: send invites, stop, exit (and any reminder action only if defined by product).

column3: From AS-060, organizer selects a Paused Auto Sync
column4: System shows paused summary + menu including send reminder, send invites, stop, exit.

column2: Concurrent Auto Syncs: two active runs
column3: Organizer creates two Auto Syncs concurrently
column4: auto sync check lists both; actions apply to selected one only.

column2: Invitee scoping: most recent unresolved request
column3: Invitee receives two Auto Sync requests at different times; replies “1” after second
column4: Reply is applied to the most recent unresolved Auto Sync message for that invitee.

column2: Invitee scoping after responding to latest
column3: Invitee replies to latest, then later replies again
column4: Second reply continues to apply to latest unresolved Auto Sync (until invites sent/stopped).

column3: Organizer types connect calendar at any time
column4: System begins calendar connect flow (OAuth/link or equivalent); does not break existing active Auto Syncs.

column2: Calendar connect affects future Auto Sync only
column3: Organizer connects calendar after completing/creating earlier no-calendar Auto Sync
column4: Existing Auto Sync continues in its mode; a newly started Auto Sync uses calendar automatically.

column2: Auto-end when all option end-times pass
column3: Auto Sync has options; wait until all option end times are in the past
column4: Auto Sync stops automatically; it no longer appears in auto sync check; no organizer message is required at auto-stop.

column2: Auto-end boundary uses end time (not start)
column3: Create option with start<now<end; ensure now passes start but not end
column4: Auto Sync does not auto-end until after end time passes.

column2: Calendar mode: save then exit before send discards
column3: Calendar mode; organizer saves options then types exit before send
column4: Auto Sync discarded; no invitee messages sent; not in auto sync check.

column2: No-calendar mode: save times then exit before send discards
column3: No calendar; organizer enters times then exit before send
column4: Auto Sync discarded; no invitee messages sent; not in auto sync check.

column2: Organizer changes mind after pause: send invites completes
column3: Auto Sync Paused; organizer chooses send invites
column4: Invites sent; Auto Sync completed/archived; no longer listed.

column2: Organizer changes mind after pause: stop cancels
column3: Auto Sync Paused; organizer chooses stop and confirms
column4: Auto Sync stopped/archived; no longer listed.

column2: Reminder targeting after some replies during pause
column3: Auto Sync Paused; some invitees reply; organizer sends reminder
column4: Reminder goes only to current non-responders at time of reminder.

column2: Organizer counts update via auto sync check
column3: Auto Sync Paused; invitees respond after pause; organizer runs auto sync check then selects
column4: Displayed responded/total and counts reflect latest replies (post-pause).

column3: Invitee replies 9 when only 1–3 options exist
column4: System treats as invalid and returns corrective instruction (numbers/none).

column3: Invitee replies 1 and 9
column4: System records valid selection(s) only (e.g., {1}); ignores invalid; no clarification required.

column3: Invitee replies 1 1 1
column4: System records option 1 once; no errors.

column2: Organizer send invites after reminder cycle
column3: Organizer triggers reminder → running → before 24h pause, chooses send invites
column4: Invites sent immediately; Auto Sync completes; pending replies after completion get “Got it — thanks.”

column2: Auto Sync start confirmation to organizer
column3: Immediately after send/launch
column4: Organizer receives confirmation indicating Auto Sync sent to TOTAL invitees.

column3: Organizer receives paused menu; replies invalid
column4: System re-prompts with same menu options; state remains paused.

column2: Organizer running manage menu input invalid
column3: Organizer in running management; replies invalid
column4: System re-prompts with allowed actions; state unchanged.
